  "title": "Operations Steering Support (OPSS) Specialist",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Steering Support (OPSS) Specialist
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Area Operations Director

Position Overview


	As an Operations Steering Support (OPSS) Specialist, you will play a key role in supporting strategic and operational planning through insights into business performance, cost development, and forecasting.
	You will drive financial transparency, performance manage operational and cost KPIs, ensure data integrity and quality, and provide a single source of truth on cost and KPI reporting.
	The role is pivotal in enabling leadership to make data-driven decisions for the Area.
	You will work closely with Regional OPSS, Area Operations, Finance, and QSC colleagues to ensure performance is effectively planned, monitored, and continuously improved.
	Disclaimer: This role does not expand the scope of responsibilities but enhances the value and consistency of existing tasks performed within OPSS.


Key Responsibilities
Performance Management &amp; Insights:


	Forecast key P&amp;L elements on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.
	Translate business targets into operational KPIs per country/cluster.
	Calculate and analyze performance gaps against Budget, Plan, and Savings targets; follow up on corrective actions with stakeholders.
	Provide forward-looking, data-driven analytics with actionable recommendations.
	Deliver insights on cost developments and proactively address unasked questions.
	Support rollout of an Operating System for performance management in Area and Region.


Cost Transparency &amp; Control:


	Support cost modeling and forecasting in collaboration with QSC and Controlling.
	Maintain terminal-level cost sheets to improve cost visibility and data accuracy.
	Monitor operational indicators influencing costs and drive unit cost performance.
	Collaborate on cost-saving initiatives, accrual accuracy, and cost categorization consistency.


Data Management &amp; Reporting:


	Serve as a data steward, ensuring accuracy and quality of unit cost and KPI reporting.
	Partner with QSCs and Regional OPSS for a unified &ldquo;one set of numbers&rdquo; approach.
	Contribute to a standardized KPI repository linked to the budget process.
	Manage TRACO updates and explain deviations on unit cost.
	Drive best practices and continuous improvement mindset across the Area.


Planning &amp; Budget Support:


	Provide input during forecasting and budgeting cycles, challenging and validating assumptions.
	Support tracking of cost and operational performance against budget.
	Assist Area leadership with scenario analysis and strategic planning initiatives.


Stakeholder Engagement &amp; Execution Support:


	Act as a source of energy within the team, fostering engagement and improvement.
	Liaise between Area, QSC, and Regional OPSS to ensure priority implementation.
	Partner with procurement and operations on savings plans and KPI alignment.
	Participate in regional workshops, training sessions, and best-practice sharing.


Required Qualifications &amp; Skills
Education &amp; Experience:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or a related field.
	2 - 5 years of experience in planning, financial analysis, cost control, or operational reporting.
	Proven OPSS-style experience in data-heavy financial planning, performance steering, and cost forecasting.
	Prior experience in regional or global roles (not just country-level) is preferred.
	Familiarity with SAP, Power BI, and advanced Excel-based reporting.


Key Competencies:


	Strong analytical mindset with a hands-on, execution-driven approach.
	Ability to synthesize complex data into actionable insights.
	Effective communicator with cross-functional alignment skills.
	High energy, empathy, and a can-do attitude.
	Structured, self-driven, and able to manage multiple priorities.
	Passion for continuous improvement and process enhancement.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruiter11@ascentech.com.ng&nbsp;using the&nbsp;&ldquo;Operations Steering Support (OPSS) Specialist&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",
